fields.name: alzheimerbroadcategory
fields.title: Alzheimer Broad Category
fields.description: There will be two broad categories taken into account. Alzheimer s disease (AD) in which the diagnostic is 100% certain and <Other> comprising the rest of Alzheimer s related categories. The <Other> category refers to Alzheime s related diagnosis which origin can be traced to other pathology eg. vascular. In this category MCI diagnosis can also be found. In summary  all Alzheimer s related diagnosis that are not pure.

fields.name: neurodegenerativescategories
fields.title: Neurodegeneratives categories
fields.description: There will be two broad categories taken into account. Parkinson s disease without disability or light disability: Without fluctuation of the effect. Dementia in Parkinson s disease

fields.name: parkinsonbroadcategory
fields.title: Parkinson Broad Category
fields.description: There will be two broad categories taken into account. Parkinson s disease without disability or light disability: Without fluctuation of the effect. Dementia in Parkinson s disease

fields.name: adnicategory
fields.title: ADNI category
fields.description: Terms aggregating illnesses into classes. Note that the diagnosis in this categories are given only for the ADNI data set.

fields.name: edsdcategory
fields.title: EDSD category
fields.description: Terms aggregating illnesses into classes. Note that the diagnosis in this categories are given only for the EDSD data set.

fields.name: ppmicategory
fields.title: PPMI category

enum: GENPD”,”Genetic PD patients with a mutation (LRRK2
REGUN”,”Genetic Unaffected patients with a mutation (LRRK2
REGPD”,”Genetic registry PD subjects with a mutation (LRRK2, GBA
REGUN”,”Genetic registry unaffected subjects with a mutation (LRRK2, GBA

fields.description: Terms aggregating the Parkinson s diseases into classes. For this instance the diagnosis given at enrollment is taken as the clinical diagnosis. Note that the diagnosis in this categories are given only for the PPMI data set.

fields.name: DIAG_etiology_1
fields.title: BNA etiology 1
fields.description: first etiology for the Bank National Alzheimer (BNA) diagnosis (sort by importance order)

fields.name: DIAG_etiology_2
fields.title: BNA etiology 2
fields.description: second etiology for the Bank National Alzheimer (BNA) diagnosis (sort by importance order)

fields.name: DIAG_etiology_3
fields.title: BNA etiology 3
fields.description: third etiology for the Bank National Alzheimer (BNA) diagnosis (sort by importance order)

fields.name: bnabroadcategory
fields.title: BNAbroadCategory
fields.description: grouping made from the BNA etiology 1. AD: alzheimers disease, VA: vascular, TD: depressive disorder, Other: other etiology

fields.name: minimentalstate
fields.title: MMSE Total scores
fields.description: The Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) or Folstein test is a 30-point questionnaire that is used extensively in clinical and research settings to measure cognitive impairment. It is commonly used to screen for dementia.

fields.name: montrealcognitiveassessment
fields.title: MoCA Total
fields.description: The Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) was designed as a rapid screening instrument for mild cognitive dysfunction. It assesses different cognitive domains: attention and concentration  executive functions  memory  language  visuoconstructional skills  conceptual thinking  calculations  and orientation. MoCA Total Scores refer to the final count obtained by patients after the complete test is performed.

fields.name: updrshy
fields.title: UPDRS HY
fields.description: The Hoehn and Yahr scale (HY) is a widely used clinical rating scale  which defines broad categories of motor function in Parkinson\u2019s disease (PD). It captures typical patterns of progressive motor impairment.

fields.name: updrstotal
fields.title: UPDRS Total
fields.description: The unified Parkinson s disease rating scale (UPDRS) is used to follow the longitudinal course of Parkinson s disease. The UPD rating scale is the most commonly used scale in the clinical study of Parkinson s disease.

fields.name: agegroup
fields.title: agegroup
fields.description: Age Group

fields.name: gender
fields.title: Gender
fields.description: Gender of the patient - Sex assigned at birth

fields.name: handedness
fields.title: Handedness
fields.description: Describes the tendency of the patient to use either the right or the left hand more naturally than the other.

fields.name: subjectage
fields.title: Exact Age
fields.description: Exact age of the subject  for datasets that allow such precision.

fields.name: subjectageyears
fields.title: Age (truncated)
fields.description: age of the subject in years (truncated value)

fields.name: apoe4
fields.title: ApoE4
fields.description: Apolipoprotein E (APOE) e4 allele: is the strongest risk factor for Late Onset Alzheimer Disease (LOAD). At least one copy of APOE-e4

fields.name: ab1_42
fields.title: Level of amyloid beta 1-42 peptides in cerebrospinal fluid
fields.description: A\u03b2 is the main component of amyloid plaques (extracellular deposits found in the brains of patients with Alzheimer’s disease). Similar plaques appear in some variants of Lewy body dementia and in inclusion body myositis (a muscle disease), while A\u03b2 can also form the aggregates that coat cerebral blood vessels in cerebral amyloid angiopathy. The plaques are composed of a tangle of regularly ordered fibrillar aggregates called amyloid fibers, a protein fold shared by other peptides such as the prions associated with protein misfolding diseases.

fields.name: amyloid42_status
fields.title: amyloid 42 status
fields.description: the amyloid 42 level is pathological if the level is inferior to 700

fields.name: ab1_40
fields.title: Level of amyloid beta 1-40 peptides in cerebrospinal fluid
fields.description: A\u03b2 is the main component of amyloid plaques (extracellular deposits found in the brains of patients with Alzheimer's disease). Similar plaques appear in some variants of Lewy body dementia and in inclusion body myositis (a muscle disease), while A\u03b2 can also form the aggregates that coat cerebral blood vessels in cerebral amyloid angiopathy. The plaques are composed of a tangle of regularly ordered fibrillar aggregates called amyloid fibers, a protein fold shared by other peptides such as the prions associated with protein misfolding diseases.

fields.name: t_tau
fields.title: Total level of tau proteins in cerebrospinal fluid
fields.description: Tau proteins (or \u03c4 proteins) are proteins that stabilize microtubules. They are abundant in neurons of the central nervous system and are less common elsewhere, but are also expressed at very low levels in CNS astrocytes and oligodendrocytes. Pathologies and dementias of the nervous system such as Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease are associated with tau proteins that have become defective and no longer stabilize microtubules properly.

fields.name: p_tau
fields.title: Level of phosphorylated tau proteins in cerebrospinal fluid
fields.description: Hyperphosphorylation of the tau protein (tau inclusions, pTau) can result in the self-assembly of tangles of paired helical filaments and straight filaments, which are involved in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease, frontotemporal dementia, and other tauopathies.

fields.name: p_tau_status
fields.title: pTau status
fields.description: the phosphorylated tau proteins level is pathological if it is superior to 60

fields.name: dataset
fields.title: Dataset
fields.description: Variable used to differentiate datasets
